frame.name: Authority
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fex name="Agent">Agent</fex> has the means to affect a <fen>Theme</fen> along the lines of a certain <fen>Domain</fen>. There is an imbalance of influence or power within a certain <fen>Domain</fen> that favors the <fen>Agent</fen> (often due to some <fen>Source</fen>) over the <fen>Theme</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">His</fex> <t>authority</t> <fex name="Theme">over his subjects</fex> was given to him <fex name="Source">by God</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Congress</fex> has the <t>power</t> to enact <fex name="Domain">laws</fex>.</ex> <ex>Only <fex name="Agent">the King</fex> has the <t>authority</t> to declare <fex name="Domain">war</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition: <def-root>The person or organization with more influence or power. </def-root>

FE.name: Theme
FE.definition: <def-root>The person or organization with less influence or power. </def-root>

FE.name: Domain
FE.definition: <def-root>A description of the area in which an <fen>Agent</fen> can affect a <fen>Theme</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>A principle factor which gave the <fen>Agent</fen> greater power or influence over the <fen>Theme</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>Describes the <fen>Agent</fen> 's influence or power in some way. <fen>Descriptor</fen>s are typically adjectives modifying nominal targets. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: power.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the influence that an entity has over others

lexUnit.name: authority.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the influence or power that an entity has over events and/or others

lexUnit.name: jurisdiction.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the authority that an entity has over events, territories, and/or others

lexUnit.name: sway.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: influence or power held by a party, often discussed informally.

lexUnit.name: dominion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the power or right of governing and controlling
